name: Thai Hot and Sour Soup
author: STEVE ALDER
summary: Fantastic authentic Thai hot and sour soup. Ideal as a starter in a Thai meal. Not very filling, but a great appetizer. Very quick and easy to prepare. The tom yum paste is hot, so try the soup before adding the chile and decide if any extra heat is required. Do not attempt if you do not have fresh coriander, as this is vital!
ingredients: 2  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - shredded
directions: In a large saucepan, bring the chicken stock to a boil
Stir in the tom yum paste and garlic, and cook for about 2 minutes
Stir in the lemon grass and kaffir lime leaves
Place the chicken in the saucepan, and cook 5 minutes, or until no longer pink and juices run clear
Add the fish sauce, lime juice, and green chile pepper
Remove from heat, and serve warm with the coriander and basil
